title: Getting the Best of My Winter of Discontent. . .
text:
I never thought I'd end up living in the suburbs. Or the midwest for that matter. In fact, I'd often joke about how either would be exactly where I couldn't end up. But here I am, an East Coast Ghost transplanted to the inner burbs of these Twin Cities of Sin from my home of NYC. And while it has been a tough adjustment, I will make the best of it here.

Which leads me to my post. I've been having this fantasy, for lack of a better word, since last summer. It may be a bit obvious or even cliche, but it's still a potent desire that has grown more intense over these last six months.

This fantasy involves you and I meeting once or twice a week. I'd come over in the morning, carrying some coffee and breakfast of your choice with me. Once I arrive, we'd sit down, chat a bit over our breakfast and coffee. And then you'd give me my list of chores for the day. These chores can be anything from cleaning your house, doing dishes, laundry, shopping/errands, small repairs, painting, or whatever I'm physically able to do. 

I take my list and get to work. Youre free to do as you please, be it just relax, watch TV, read, nap, get other stuff done, whatever. The time is yours. 

Once I finish my chores, you invite me into your bedroom. You take off your clothes down to your bra and underwear. If I did my job well, you reward me with a nice backrub. 

Then we have some mind blowing sex. You let me go down on you, two or three times, and 69 with me once I make you come the first time. But really you're still in control. I am in that bed to serve you in whatever ways you desire, from vanilla to kink. The only constants are my s
Serving you and ending our time together
by giving you a relaxing backrub. 

I think that such an obvious but still passionate arrangement would make this winter and beyond pretty damn wonderful.

I'm open to *who* I'm looking for. I don't really have a type, per se. I would prefer someone my age or older (I have usually dated women over 45, but not exclusively over 45). Beyond that, I'm open minded assuming the chemistry is there. I will confess to having a weird thing for pregnant women, but that's neither here nor there ;).

If you like the sound of my fantasy so far, well, you know where to reach me. Your pic gets mine, of course. And please put "Winter" in the subject line so I can weed out the spam. Thanks :)

title: You've been around the block a few times . . .
text:
You've been around the block a few times. . . stopping on your way to get married, maybe had kids, took on a mortgage, built a career, and experienced a lot of joy and maybe some sorrow over the years . . . now your kids are grown and gone, you're in your late 40's to mid 50's, you're reasonably healthy and fit and getting better every day. You have goals and dreams. You realize that your marriage is not what is once was and that you and your spouse have grown apart, you long for something more . . . you have thought for a while about a quiet friendship with a married gentleman. One who is in a similar place as you with like minded goals and dreams. Someone tall, healthy, fit, attractive, active, intelligent, creative, kind, funny, playful, ambitious . . . you know that you shouldn't but you also know that you're not alone in your thoughts. You click on reply and craft a thoughtful response that starts with "Hello" . . . and this could be the start of a wonderful friendship.

title: Because you want attention and I want something pretty to look at
text:
Because let's face it, the truth of it is there's no difference between meeting someone in a bar from meeting them on Craigslist. We're all here for the same thing...

Sex. 

Hot, sweaty, freaky, buy-new-Victoria's-Secret-that-afternoon-put-your-phone-on-silent-that-night-marathon sex.

Just kidding. Mostly.

We're here because we think we're missing out on something. Something that everyone else is in on, that lets them connect, smile, hold hands, be fantastically adorable and simultaneously (you don't know it, but your attention just perked because I used a word with six syllables) disgusting. And after the honeymoon phase runs dry and the spark dims, become bored with one another and fight over insignificant things until one of them has the balls to call it quits and they each go off to find other pretty people to make out with.

Whatever, it's a terrible cycle, and it's like dancing because you can sort of appreciate it from afar even if you can't do it that well and then you get drunk and try and it's okay and maybe even fun at first until you see yourself and realize how silly the whole thing is and go back home to your comfortable couch and your comfortable book and your comfortable life and you don't really need to be with someone but it's been a while since you've danced with someone that you think it might be different or at least pass the time and at least someone will be paying attention to you and taking you out and telling you how pretty you are or treat you terribly and never tell you how pretty you are and somehow this will make you want to try harder.

Then again, you could just be here for the shits and giggles and fleeting excitement of talking to a complete stranger. 

Hmmm? Me? What am I here for? Probably all of the above. Or maybe just bored and this is the only sad little creative outlet I'm getting these days. And wasn't completely kidding about wanting something pretty to look at, though not entirely because "isn't everyone?" In a parallel universe, instead of having a very practical and well paying job, there is a parallel universe version of me that went the starving artist route and fed his desire to be an artist instead of keeping it as passion hobby. I'm pre-wired to be drawn to the aesthetically pleasing. And that's not a roundabout way of saying "no fat chicks, hot or gtfo!" - hot/beautiful girls are a dime a dozen and most won't have anything interesting to say. I want someone that can keep a conversation going, is only mildly aware they're attractive, and has an actual life story. 

As for what I have to offer...you've read this far so you must already be halfway interested in what's going on in my head, right? I have the whole tall, reasonably handsome thing going on too if that's your thing.. I'm single, fit, healthy and have a unique sense of humor.

Except that I don't dance. I know the moves and can understand the fun of it and sometimes after a couple drinks might try it for a bit, but then I see how silly the whole thing is and go back to my comfortable life.

If any of my silly rant has piqued your interest, send me a note and let's talk.

title: Polyerotic Paganish
text:
I guess the above describes me, but describing what I am looking for in friends is going to be a bit harder. Nevertheless, the yearning for connection is too strong to ignore. I recently happened to find a book on the problems facing modern men who desire to form male friendships in our go-it-alone, homophobic present-day society, and it has really gotten me to thinking of how much I long for "manly friendships." So this is the impetus for me to speak aloud what I desire to manifest. 

Just today I learned of a poet and explorer, Everett Ruess, who disappeared into the wilderness in 1934. His last letter, written to his brother, included this: "I have always been unsatisfied with life as most people live it. Always I want to live more intensely and richly. Why muck and conceal one's true longings and loves, when by speaking of them one might find someone to understand them, and by acting on them one might discover oneself?" -- Everett Ruess, 1914 

I am a male of northwestern European descent (Irish and German, to be exact), some kind of Pagan but not a groupie and not inclined to adopt a name that's cringe-inducing, like Raevyn Moonfyre or something equally cloying. Heading into the middle forties, kinda wishing I had gone ahead and bought that back forty instead of a house in the big city, but oh well. . . At 25, your interests and priorities are much different.

Average looking in some ways, unusual in others. In a permanent relationship with another man. I guess I am polyamorous, but I find that word an uncomfortable fit because I don't need or want to jump anything that moves. Still, I am "monogamish" with my partner's full knowledge and consent, but I rarely exercise the option. If all this is not your cup of tea, then move on. I am being upfront about that so you can choose to express interest--or not.

"When energy finds other energy and it melds together, it's not something to let go of. A connection of spirits can be rare for some; it is, for me, very rare. I know energy though, I know it the moment I sense it, and if it collides or syncs with mine. The spirit is separate from the body. It will do things without your knowledge, such as seek out other energies that compliment or coincide." Credit: Sin Madison

There's no exact word for what I seek. Bromance comes close, but the connotation of "bro" chafes and reeks of frat-boy masculinity. I seek someone to "talk shop" with, someone to do paganish things with, or at least good-humoredly go along with one another's interests, maybe expand our own experiences in the world, to try something neither of us has done before. Some examples might be an art fair, or attending gem and mineral shows (I'm a rock-hound and love studying crystals and such), or going to May Day in Powderhorn Park, or discussing what we're reading, or working on a writing project, or doing something creative (I'm learning how to work with metals, someday hoping to make some amateur jewelry with some of my rocks and crystals). After 20 years of working full-time, I'm at a point where I have the relative luxury of setting my own schedule, and making time to be creative. And my partner is not creative in the same way I am, so my creative efforts are always solitary. And I swear, all the art classes and metalworking classes are filled with women. I am always the only man. Where are the guys?

Bromance, to my mind, would not exclude safe, sensible consensual sexual activity, necessarily, but hopping into bed would not be the first impulse, either. It is being comfortable enough to touch one another with affectionate sincerity, snuggling a bit while talking, yet understanding that neither of us has a romantic claim on the other. "Fuck buddies" is too crude, as is "friends with benefits." "Lovers" is too much, since I already have a partner. I guess "polyerotic" is as good as anything. I'm open to discussion, for certain. I'm quite used to blazing a trail, or residing in the margins, or being the only one of my kind for miles around. Why would this be any different?

I am someone who prefers a few close friends versus many acquaintances. If you're familiar with the Meyers-Briggs Interest Inventory, I am an INFJ (Introverted iNtuitive Feeling Judging) of which only 1% of the population matches this classification. I do not make friends easily, but the ones I open up to are the true ones.

I could go on, but my hope is that some man or men out there stumble across this posting and decide to investigate further. So please send me a note, preferably with a recent, clear picture of your face, and tell me about yourself. Don't be concerned about age, as I am an old soul and have always had older friends. I do ask for truthfulness, decency, sincerity, and good hygiene (not limited to physical, but mental, emotional and spiritual as well).

I have been thinking about trying the dating scene again. My last serious relationship was about 8 years ago now and I guess you could say it took some extra time to heal after that ended. I just recently turned 30 and have been thinking a lot about finding someone to spend some quality time with.

I live alone in a shoebox apartment in downtown Minneapolis, and also work in the area. I am more of a home body which may be the reason that I have been having some problems meeting people. I do enjoy going out on a rare occasion but I think I got that out of my system a few years ago. I feel as though I should mention that I am sober, as it is a big part of my life. I don't care if someone drinks (like a regular person) and it's definitely not a deal breaker by any means. 

In my spare time I enjoy a lot of things that everyone else does, spending time with loved ones, watching tv/movies, listening to music, going for walks, spending time outdoors, going to the gym to try and get more fit, and exploring new things in the kitchen. 

I am looking for someone who values their independence and is not looking for someone to complete them but is looking for someone to make them better. I tend to be a very loving and kind individual to those that are important to me. 

Well that is just a little bit about me, if you would like to know more feel free to send me a note, I have photos that I am happy to share just felt weird uploading them to a Craigslist ad. 

Cheers!

You are looking to scratch that itch which you feel in quiet moments and all too often you feel yourself writing off even though you desire it strongly. I have come to figure that these moments are the quiet desperation that Thoreau wrote of and part of me is still not willing to go peacefully and accept this in life.
So here I am. 
I am a good natured, outgoing person whom is confident with who I am and how I appear. I am creative and have many activities that keep me busy and I will try anything once. I don't have any vices that are too harmful with the exception of searching Craigslist for what is missing in my life or marriage. I tend to think that even though I am
happy with what I have , I still keep pushing myself to develop as a person, and yet still find myself wanting of the passions that are not in my everyday life. Upon deeper reflection, i believe I tend to yearn more for the opportunity to let out these thoughts than try to fulfill them- meaning a friend or confidant with which to share and get feedback from, and in return would do the same.
I dream of the opportunity of a woman that would sit down next to me and strike up a conversation which would grow into an undefined and deep personal connection for us. We would share ideas, laughs, coffee and whatever the other one needs with no pressure or judgement. This would not be a relationship of expectations or dependency, but one that supports the other.
